definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: I'm the first guy to drive long-distance on Mars.
sentences.chinese: 我是第一個在火星上開長途車的人。

sentences.english: The coach driver was seriously hurt.
Good morning. How did you sleep after your long bus ride?
sentences.chinese: 早上好。坐了長時間的長途車後，你睡得怎麼樣？

sentences.english: A coach crashed into a tree last night.
sentences.chinese: 一輛長途車昨晚撞上了一顆樹。

sentences.english: But it takes only 5 minutes to walk from the long distance coach station to the hostel.
sentences.chinese: 不過，從長途車站到旅店步行也只要5分鐘。

sentences.english: We can get there by coach.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘坐長途車能到達那裏。

sentences.english: We can get there first by coach and then by cable car .
sentences.chinese: 我們先乘長途車然後再坐纜車能到那裏。

definition: local bus or train/slow train with many stops
abbr. for 搭鐵接線|搭铁接线/chassis grounding (i.e. using the chassis as ground, to serve as a return path for current in an electric circuit)
shuttle bus (or train)/train or bus traveling only part of its normal route
not on time/late (public transport, airlines)/overdue/behind schedule/delayed
vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)
to make a detour/to take the long route
soft sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a softer bunk)
